meanings.definition: A former Dutch coin worth 5 cents.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used stuivers to buy bread.
meanings.sent2: I found a few stuivers in my grandfather's old coin collection.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was full of stuivers, making it heavy to carry.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a handful of shiny stuivers, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of stuivers clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: He saved every stuiver he earned from his paper route.
meanings.sent2: I only had a few stuivers left after buying the candy.
meanings.sent3: She bet her last stuiver on the horse race, hoping for a win.
meanings.sent4: His generosity knew no bounds; he would give away his last stuiver to help others.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's cup rattled with the few stuivers tossed into it.
